hint.p: For a Periodical, on the Periodical tab, one would normally input the following information:
Input the name(s) of the editor(s) in Names and Roles, leaving "editor" selected as Role.

Analyse each corporate name into separate name parts if it consists of several components. Record the more general designation in the first field and the more specific designation in the second field. If this is not possible, enter the whole name in one field.
If the editor is a person, choose "Personal Name", "Given Name" and "Family" and record the information accordingly.

Input the title of the periodical in Title Information, dividing this into Title and Subtitle, if possible. If the title begins with an article like "A" or "The," remove this from the title and place it in Non Sort.
In case the publication is electronic (or also electronic) , input in URL the web address of the publication.
In Origin Information, input the city in which the publisher resides and the name of the publisher. If more than one of these is in evidence, input the main one or the first of them.
In the case of a periodical which has stopped publication, in Date of Issue, input the year when the periodical started publication, using "start" to mark this.
In the case of a periodical which has stopped publication, in Date of Issue, input the year when the periodical ceased publication, using "end" to mark this.
In the case of a periodical which has stopped publication, in Physical Description, input the extent of the book in volumes, e.g. "14 v."
In case the periodical is (also) electronic, input in URL the web address of the book.
Finally, in Identifier input the ISSN number of the periodical, and a DOI, if available.
For an Article in Periodical, on the Article tab, one would normally input the following information:
Input the name(s) of the author(s) in Names and Roles, leaving "author" selected as Role. Divide the name into Given Name and Family Name, if possible.

Input the title of the article in Title Information, dividing this into Title and Subtitle, if possible. If the title begins with an article like "A" or "The," remove this from the title and place it in Non Sort.
In case the publication is electronic (or also electronic) , input in URL the web address of the publication.
Finally, in Identifier input the DOI number of the article, if available.
Use the Periodical tab to catalogue the periodical that the article occurs in and the place of the article inside the periodical.
Input the title of the periodical in Periodical Title. Follow the same guidelines that apply to book titles.

Input the name(s) of the editor(s) of the periodical in Institutional Editor(s) of Periodical. Only editors of the periodical as a whole should be input, not the editor of a single issue (ususally a guest editor). Here provision is made only for inputting institutional editors.

In Location of Article in Periodical note the volume number and issue number in Volume and Issue, as well as the year of publication of the periodical in which the article has appeared in Year of Publication. Enter the page numbers of the article in the volume and/or issue it occurs in in Page Extent.
Finally, in Identifier input the ISSN number of the periodical and its DOI, if available.

item.label: Contribution to Edited Volume (in Latin Script)

hint.p: For a Book, on the Book tab, one would normally input the following information:
Input the name(s) of the author(s) in Names and Roles, selecting "author" as Role. Divide the name into Given Name and Family Name, if possible.
If there is more than one author, repeat the Names and Roles fields by clicking the '+' button.

Input the title of the book in Title Information, dividing this into Title and Subtitle, if possible. If the title begins with an article like the English "A" or "The", remove this from the title and input it in Non Sort.

In Origin Information, input the city in which the publisher resides and the name of the publisher. If more than one of these is in evidence, input the main one or the first of them. Finally, input the year the book was issued or copyrighted.
In Physical Description, input the extent of the book in pages, e.g. "ix, 214 p."
In case the book is (also) electronic, input in URL the web address of the book.
Finally, in Identifier input the ISBN number of the book, preferably a 13-digit ISBN, and a DOI, if available.
Use the Book Series tab only if the book is part of a series.
Input the title of the series in Series Title. Follow the same guidelines that apply to book titles.

Input the name(s) of the editor(s) of the series in Names and Roles. Choose "personal," "corporate" or "conference" as Type of Name as applies to the book in question. If the "editor" is not personal, select "(none selected)" instead of "Given Name" and "Family Name."
In Location of Book in Series note the volume number of the book within the series.
In Identifier input the ISSN number of the book series and a DOI, if available.
For a Review of Book, on the Book Review tab, input is the same as for an article in a periodical. Here, one would normally input the following information:
Input the name(s) of the author(s) in Names and Roles, leaving "author" selected as Role. Divide the name into Given Name and Family Name, if possible.

Input the title of the article in Title Information, dividing this into Title and Subtitle, if possible. If the title begins with an article like "A" or "The," remove this from the title and place it in Non Sort.
In case the publication is electronic (or also electronic) , input in URL the web address of the publication.
Finally, in Identifier input the DOI number of the article, if available.

On the Periodical With Book Review and Book Reviewed tab, input is complicated by the fact that information relating to two different publications are input:
Information relating to the periodical in which the book review occurs, plus the location of the book review within the periodical
Information relating to the book reviewed

The first part, Location of Book Review, is the same as cataloguing an article in a periodical. Record the title of the book review itself, regardless of whether or not it contains part of or all of the title, etc. of the monograph being reviewed.
Input the title of the periodical in Periodical Title. Follow the same guidelines that apply to book titles.

Input the name(s) of the editor(s) of the periodical in Institutional Editor(s) of Periodical. Only editors of the periodical as a whole should be input, not the editor of a single issue (ususally a guest editor). Here provision is made only for inputting institutional editors.

In Location of Article in Periodical note the volume number and issue number in Volume and Issue, as well as the year of publication of the periodical in which the article has appeared in Year of Publication. Enter the page numbers of the article in the volume and/or issue it occurs in in Page Extent.
Finally, in Identifier input the ISSN number of the periodical and its DOI, if available.
The second part, Books Reviewed, relates to the monograph that is reviewed. Follow here the guidelines for cataloguing a monograph on its own.
Repeat Book(s) Reviewed as needed, by clicking the '+' button.
Input the name(s) of the author(s) in Names and Roles, selecting "author" as Role. Divide the name into Given Name and Family Name, if possible.
If there is more than one author, repeat the Names and Roles fields by clicking the '+' button.

Input the title of the book in Title Information, dividing this into Title and Subtitle, if possible. If the title begins with an article like the English "A" or "The", remove this from the title and input it in Non Sort.

In Origin Information, input the city in which the publisher resides and the name of the publisher. If more than one of these is in evidence, input the main one or the first of them. Finally, input the year the book was issued or copyrighted.
In Physical Description, input the extent of the book in pages, e.g. "ix, 214 p."
In case the book is (also) electronic, input in URL the web address of the book.
Finally, in Identifier input the ISBN number of the book, preferably a 13-digit ISBN, and a DOI, if available.
